NCBSinfo is an application for regular use, especially helpful for people working at the National Centre for Biological Science (NCBS), Bangalore. Our aim is to create a mobile application, which will serve as an application-cum-database for important information pertaining to NCBS. With the help of this, we will try to reduce the time spent on searching for shuttle timings and contact numbers.

This is NOT an official NCBS app and has been created ONLY for personal use. All the information provided in this application was last updated on January 1, 2019. Though a lot of effort has been taken to curate the information, minor discrepancies may still exist. Developers are not responsible for any such information presented/conveyed through this application. In case of any bug/error(s), please report it to the developers; measures will be taken to rectify the same.

Best part of an open source app is that you will know exactly what is going on inside the app. We encourage you to check our source code on GitHub ( https://github.com/NCBSinfo/NCBSinfo ). Code is heavily commented for readability. We ask for following permissions from you



Permission

(To send anonymous crash report in case of crash)

However, this app will work perfectly fine without any of above permissions. You can block them if you are really paranoid about them :)



Google and Firebase analytics

We receive some anonymous statistics from all users who have installed this app. This information generally includes Android Version, Default language, Country, App version, Uninstall count etc. See Google privacy policies regarding this.



Crash Report

This will send us anonymous crash reports (if any) which we use to fix bugs and make the app better :) However, if you have switched OFF this from settings, this report will NOT be sent.





Check latest and full privacy statement here .

Dear app user,



The NCBSinfo project started as a small personal app in December 2016, which I had used to track shuttle timings in NCBS. Soon it\'s user base expanded and now (as of December 2018) it has almost 450 daily users and more than 1000 installs. Unfortunately, now I can not dedicate more time for maintaining this app and have to stop further development. However, to make this self-sustained, I have added a solid foundation for editing and managing one\'s own timetable. If you are not aware of this function, please check \'Manage Transport\' option from \'Information\' section. You will be able to use this app smoothly, even if there are any changes in transport timings. One can even create their own routes. I will fix (any) bugs and timetable changes until 16 October 2019. If anyone is interested in developing this app further, feel free to contribute to this open source app on GitHub. If you have any suggestion or feedback, please drop me an email on contact@secretbiology.com or ncbs.mod@gmail.com.



I am very grateful for all the love and encouragement provided by you. I hope this app will also help you in the future. Thank you!

Bidding Adieu!!



Yours

Rohit Suratekar
